summary: This is an email chain from September 2021 between a U.S. Attorney's Office prosecutor and a Customs and Border Protection (CBP) Task Force Officer. The prosecutor requests and receives CBP travel records for Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell for the period 1997-2000, specifically inbound arrival dates. The document highlights law enforcement's ongoing investigation into their travel patterns.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject whose U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) travel records for 1997-2000 are being requested and analyzed by the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The secondary subject whose CBP travel records for 1997-2000 are being requested and analyzed alongside Jeffrey Epstein's.

persons.name: Jared
persons.context: Mentioned by a CBP Task Force Officer as having been briefed on the prosecutor's request for travel records.

connections.description: Their travel records are being analyzed together by law enforcement, indicating a close association and coordinated investigation into their movements.

events.title: CBP Travel Records Provided
events.description: A CBP Task Force Officer emails a prosecutor with analyzed CBP inbound travel records for Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell covering 1997-2000.

events.title: Epstein Inbound Travel
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein arrived in the United States, according to CBP inbound records.

events.title: Epstein and Maxwell Inbound Travel
events.description: Both Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell arrived in the United States on this date, according to CBP inbound records.

keyFacts: Law enforcement in 2021 was actively obtaining and analyzing historical CBP travel records for Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell from 1997-2000.
Specific inbound travel dates for Epstein (12/11/1999, 1/21/2000) and Maxwell (6/23/1997, 8/6/1997, 7/20/1998, 7/24/1998, 12/18/1999, 1/21/2000) were identified from CBP data.
The document notes a data limitation: outbound departure records were not consistently recorded during that timeframe, so only inbound arrivals are available.
The communication is marked as Law Enforcement Sensitive/For Official Use Only, indicating the sensitive nature of the ongoing investigation.
The request originated from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, showing federal prosecutors were involved in gathering this evidence.
